titles.title: Older Americans Economic Security Act of 1993
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a deduction for expenses of providing care for certain elderly individuals, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 6/10/1993--Introduced. Older Americans Economic Security Act of 1993 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a tax deduction for qualified elderly care expenses which exceed five percent of the taxpayer's adjusted gross income. Allows a charitable deduction to physicians and registered professional nurses for medical services or goods donated to elderly individuals. Allows tax-free withdrawals from individual retirement accounts to pay long-term care expenses or to purchase insurance covering such expenses.
